result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W. Gross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.  May not have contact with AMM or her family or residence, or any children under age 18, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No pornography, no use of computer/internet w/o agent approval.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 7/16/15 - Sentencing (Filed in 14CF146)
7/16/15 - Sentencing (Original filed in 14CF146)
Amended report
From linked case #15CF275.  jk/cp
Presentence incarceration credit.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 3 years WSP consecutive to 14CF146; 1 year initial confinement w/credit for 109 days served; 2 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is not eligible for CIP; deft is eligible for SAP; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied from 13CM1326 to costs.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 thru 6 are dismissed and read in.  Deft pleads no contest.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 7/16/15 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Barth states a new offer was received that the deft wants time to consider.  FPT continued to 6/9/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Barth the FPT of 6/4/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled to 6/5/15 at 10am, as he did not have it on his calendar for 6/4/15 and has a conflict w/a Racine case.
Final pre-trial on June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No record made.  Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared in custody.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Atty Michael Barth is in trial in another court and unavailable for today's hearing.  FPT reset for 6/4/15 at 8:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody)  with Atty. Michael Barth. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 6. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 5-11-15 @ 8:30am with 13CM1326. Atty. Barth also has a trial scheduled in Br. 8 at this time. Bond continued.
to Preliminary Hearing

1:37  Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney M Barth. CLerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  4-23-15 @ 8:45. Bond continued.
atty: M Barth

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. Aileen Henry. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning. Atty. Henry moves to withdraw due to conflict. Court grants motion, pending appointment of new attorney. SPD's Office to appoint new counsel. Time limits tolled by court. Status conference on 4-14-15 @ 1:00pm. Bond continued.

1:22 pm    Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney AIleen Henry.  Clerk:  LE/    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Commissioner on  4-8-15 @ 10:00 am.  $10,000 cash bond set with conditions.

*No Contact w/ Randy M or his residence
946.49(1)(b) - Fel bail jumping - 3 Cts  - 946.49(1)(a) - Misd bail jumping - 3 Cts
Warrant served, def. in custody.  Return on warrant today at 1:00 before Intake Commissioner.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person w/Atty H Edwards, special appearance.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Edwards moves to withdraw as counsel.  So ordered.  Warrant remains in effect; deft taken into custody from court.  Preliminary hearing to be scheduled in intake court.
